Intro.0: A 19-year old flaw can still be leveraged to compromise prominent websites. Three security researchers talk about the updated "ROBOT attack".
Intro.1: Known for hijacking social media accounts, the self-styled white hat hacking group OurMine took over several HBO Twitter and Facebook accounts which included "Game of Thrones," "Girls," and "Ballers."
Intro.2: Watch what you click: Cybercriminals are using a video of Adam Levine's audition video to trick users into downloading malicious software.
Intro.3: Facebook, Instagram, Tinder, and other sites were down for about an hour. Facebook is back up now and has sent a brief word  of how a change in infrastructure configuration could have caused the outage.
Intro.4: Hours after the fateful crash of Malaysia Airlines 777, suspicious .tk links on Twitter posts led to spyware downloads, while “actual footage“ posts on Facebook pointed to adware.
Intro.5: A 19-year old flaw can still be leveraged to compromise prominent websites. Three security researchers talk about the updated "ROBOT attack".
Intro.6: Known for hijacking social media accounts, the self-styled white hat hacking group OurMine took over several HBO Twitter and Facebook accounts which included "Game of Thrones," "Girls," and "Ballers."
Intro.7: Watch what you click: Cybercriminals are using a video of Adam Levine's audition video to trick users into downloading malicious software.
Intro.8: Facebook, Instagram, Tinder, and other sites were down for about an hour. Facebook is back up now and has sent a brief word  of how a change in infrastructure configuration could have caused the outage.
Intro.9: Hours after the fateful crash of Malaysia Airlines 777, suspicious .tk links on Twitter posts led to spyware downloads, while “actual footage“ posts on Facebook pointed to adware.
Intro.10: The Senate Intelligence Committee has asked top tech companies Google, Facebook and Twitter to testify about Russian interference in US politics, a Senate aide confirmed Wednesday.  [Read More]
Intro.11: Facebook has announced a new measure meant to improve the security of user accounts, saying that it has begun notifying users on suspected account compromise.  [Read More]
Intro.12: Facebook revealed that it received between 9,000 and 10,000 requests for user data from US authorities in the second half of last year, as it seeks to shield itself from a growing scandal.  [Read More]
Intro.13: Facebook on Thursday began letting people locked out of their profiles get back in with the help of friends.  [Read More]
Intro.14: Paul Ceglia was arrested on Friday for using a forged contract with Facebook co-founder Mark Zuckerberg to lay claim to half of the world's leading online social network. Prosecutors said that an investigation revealed that the contract and emails were bogus.  [Read More]
Intro.15: A study from Barracuda Networks, Facebook: Fake Profiles vs. Real Users, Barracuda researchers analyzes a random sampling of 2,884 active Facebook accounts to identify key differences between average real user accounts and fake accounts created by attackers and fraudsters.  [Read More]
Intro.16: Facebook introduces simple new security feature to help users check if the emails they receive are legitimate or part of a phishing campaign  [Read More]
Intro.17: Facebook awards Internet Defense Prize of $100,000 to researchers who described a novel method for detecting spear-phishing in enterprises  [Read More]
Intro.18: Researchers at Kaspersky Labs have found examples of malicious Chrome applications targeting Facebook users in Brazil.  [Read More]
Intro.19: Zscaler Likejacking Prevention Proactively Identifies and Prevents Malicious Facebook Attacks, Scams and Spam That Leverage "Like" Buttons and Other Widgets  [Read More]
Intro.20: While Lost Door is not new malware, it easily customizable and consequently "can be hard to detect and protect against, posing a challenge to IT administrators."  [Read More]
Intro.21: Spy Banker Trojan targets Brazil via Facebook and Twitter with a downloader hosted on Google’s cloud platform  [Read More]
Intro.22: Facebook malware infected at least 260,000 users. The Trojan is designed to like posts, subscribe to profiles and follow people on Twitter.  [Read More]
Intro.23: Facebook's Threat Infrastructure team recently helped take down the Lecpetex botnet, which affected thousands of accounts.  [Read More]
Intro.24: Security researchers from Bitdefender have warned that a new instant messaging Trojan has infected hundreds of computers all over the world.  [Read More]
Intro.25: Researchers at Trusteer have discovered a variant of Zeus with a P2P component that is targeting high profile sites such as Facebook, Google, Hotmail, and Yahoo in order to compromise debit and credit card data.  [Read More]
Intro.26: Sophos, Trend Micro and Symantec have inked deals with Facebook, under which the social networking giant will use website reputation services from the vendors to help protect users from malicious links.  [Read More]
Intro.27: Researchers at Trusteer have discovered a variant of the Ice IX Trojan being used to trick Facebook users into revealing their credit card information.  [Read More]
Intro.28: Researchers at Kaspersky Labs have found examples of malicious Chrome applications targeting Facebook users in Brazil.  [Read More]
